page.title: 13Community Involvement
page.content:
During the 1970's certain schools in Clwyd were designated as community schools. Although Darland School was not one of these links were developed with the community which have proved very valuable.
Activities include charity work, assistance with playgroups, daytime and evening voluntary groups, and evening adult classes. The annual Fun Run is an important part of the school's charity work. Pupils following Child Care courses are encouraged to help local playgroups.
Voluntary groups use school facilities but there is no paid tutor. The groups are managed according to the wishes of the members.
